intro: Polyalthia merrittii, commonly known as the Bornean flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with ovate to lanceolate leaflets and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in tropical regions.
